file_content.text: Come then, Jedi. I assure you, I will be prepared.
The Republic colonists have a temporary shelter near some ruins. Sending the coordinates now....
The Sith assassin is noted for being a master of beasts. She likely won't be alone. I advise caution.
Good luck, Jedi....
I've already sent the pirate gang's coordinates. Good hunting, Jedi.
Once you're finished, come to my location. I'll hand over the doctor as promised.
Hello again. Your ability to survive is impressive, to say the least.
Not my finest performance, but serviceable.
Do not fear, Doctor Godera is unharmed. I painlessly rendered him unconscious and gently carried him to safety.
That trick only works once. Next time, I'll be ready.
You won't pull that off again.
There doesn't need to be a next time.
How did you make yourself appear to be Rodian?
That was you?
A good Watcher never gives up his secrets.
I can't say the same for your assassins.
Your men are dead.
Their loss is regrettable, but they understood what's at stake.
We could continue this chase forever--but what a waste of resources. I suggest a compromise.
Give me time to administer truth serum to Doctor Godera. Once he reveals his secrets, he's yours. We'll both have what we want.
You've already deceived me twice. I'd be a fool to give you another chance.
You must think I'm stupid.
My deceptions have failed to produce the desired result. Now, I'm telling the truth.
I don't see what I'm getting out of this.
What's in it for me?
I want to end your existence. Is that part of the deal?
Including your death?
Not as such--but you'll find my counteroffer more than fair.
I will purchase time for interrogating Doctor Godera by offering you something of great personal interest.
Pirates have unearthed powerful artifacts once belonging to the Jedi Covenant. I believe you will find these relics highly useful.
You've done your research. Where will I find these things?
I'm interested.
The pirates aren't far, but you'll have to move quickly. A Sith has already bargained for the artifacts and is on his way there.
Can't believe you're letting this guy manipulate you.
I won't let these artifacts fall into the wrong hands.
This isn't about him.
Silence, Padawan.
Your Master recognizes opportunity when she hears it.
Your Master recognizes opportunity when he hears it.
Question my decisions again, and I'll have you expelled from the order.
You're way out of line.
I... that won't be necessary, Master.
T7 = confused // Chasing artifacts = correct choice?
I've got this under control, Teeseven. Trust me.
Yes, I believe so.
T7 = trust Jedi always
It's my decision, not yours.
Jedi = in charge // T7 = support Jedi decisions
If you can't be silent and do as I say, I'll have you deactivated.
Shut up or shut down.
T7 = sorry
I've never heard of this "Covenant."
Jedi Covenant?
A secret cabal disbanded centuries ago. Murdered their own Padawans hoping to prevent the Sith's return. They were powerful zealots.
I will not be distracted by lost trinkets.
My duty is to stop you.
A Sith has arranged to acquire these artifacts. Can you risk allowing your enemies the power they contain?
He's bluffing. This is a trick.
Your Master recognizes the truth. This opportunity won't come again.
Choice = difficult // Variables = multiple
The Sith is on his way to the pirate camp even now. You know what you must do.
These artifacts belong to the Jedi, not pirates--or Sith.
Tell me where the camp is.
If you're lying, you're dead.
I'm coming for the doctor. If anything happens to him, you'll pay.
I won't let you distract me.
Hmph. I shall have to revise your profile. You're more unpredictable than we thought.
A Sith assassin is on Taris preparing to massacre a small Republic settlement. I can tell you where.
Tell me how to save my people.
Then do it.
I can only provide the location. How you stop your enemy is up to you.
Why would you do that?
The information Doctor Godera possesses is worth more than terrorizing defenseless colonists.
My only concern is rescuing Doctor Godera. The colonists will have to defend themselves.
My mission is to stop you.
Colonists against a Sith assassin? At least the battle will be brief....
I know you won't risk innocent lives. It's not in your nature.
We have to help those people.
First Jedi duty = protect life
Rescue your settlement. When that's done, come here and you'll receive Doctor Godera unharmed. You have my word.
Whether you're lying or not, I can't condemn those people to die.
I'll go to the settlement.
You'd better not be lying.
I'm coming for you now. Prepare to die.
I won't let you distract me.
Your profile needs updating. You're not the hero everyone believes you are, are you?
We're just letting those people die....
Jedi = leave colonists to die? // Logic error
Critical damage... circuits failing....
Transmitting my maker's new coordinates to you now. Save him. Do not let my functions end in vain....
Your main processor and memory circuits are intact. If there's a way to repair you, I'll find it.
I'll save your memory core.
You served well. I'll take it from here.
Goodbye, droid.
Filthy Imps... kill them all.
Useless pile of junk... this is what happens to droids that don't follow orders.
[Destroy RE-M0's remains]
Jedi = hates droids? // T7 = worried
Don't let your little Teeseven hear you talking like that.
RE-M0 = loyal droid // Jedi = salvage RE-M0 memory core?
Memory core + new chassis = RE-M0 second chance
Maybe you should salvage the memory core. See if you can't fix him up with a new body.
It's worth a shot, after all he did for us.
I'll make sure Remo gets an upgrade.
[Salvage RE-M0's memory core]
I have more important things to do than fix machines.
[Abandon RE-M0's memory core]
The last thing this galaxy needs is another willful droid.
[Destroy RE-M0's memory core]
Why are you still here? Those filthy Imps have my maker!
I finished resetting all the tracking relays. Is that central computer online?
Affirmative. Triangulating Doctor Godera's coordinates now....
This facility has outlived its usefulness, and my programming provides no secondary mission. I am uncertain how to proceed.
Serving Republic cowards is unacceptable, but I am not armed to combat Imp scum. Recommendation?
Don't go anywhere until I find Doctor Godera.
Stay put.
A prudent course of action. Perhaps I can monitor Imp scum from here....
Doctor Godera needs all the help he can get. You should come.
Join me.
Excellent suggestion. Perhaps I can acquire new mission parameters from my maker.
Shut down. Your mission is over.
Deactivate yourself.
I am uncertain that is correct, but I will take your suggestion under advisement.
Triangulation complete. Transmitting the coordinates to you now....
Hurry, Jedi. My maker is too good for those Imp scum.
I am coming, but do not wait for me. My maker needs you, Jedi.
Do not permit the Imp scum to harm my maker. I am counting on you, Jedi.
I am repairing the central computer. You must reset the tracking relays.
My designation is RE-M0. Doctor Godera assigned me to this facility. Primary function: enemy surveillance.
The facility was compromised when Republic cowards arrived on Taris and again by these Imp scum.
Your maker is in danger. Can you tell me where he is?
I need to find Godera.
Why do you call the Republic cowards? These people died defending you.
Republic cowards?
Republic cowards surrendered to the Empire many years ago. These deaths do not alter that fact.
My programming forbids cooperation with non-Godera life-forms, except under extreme circumstances. That criteria is now met.
You should've cooperated with the Republic. Tell me where Godera is, or I'll use you for spare parts.
Tell me all you know, or else.
Coercion is no longer required. Cooperation protocols were unlocked by Imp invasion.
Watcher One reprogrammed this facility's tracking relays. He traced Doctor Godera's encrypted bioscan to its present location.
If it worked for Watcher One, it'll work for us.
Then we'll do the same.
The Imp scum destroyed the central computer hoping to prevent this. I must repair it while you reset the outdoor tracking relays.
How could Watcher One do all that when we couldn't?
How did he pull that off?
Imperial Intelligence is well funded and highly motivated. Filthy Imps....
After all the time we controlled this place, an Imperial finds Godera right away? Pathetic.
Watcher One deserves to win.
Watcher One displays exceptional intelligence, for Imp scum. He even sabotaged the central computer before leaving.
Locating my maker requires repairing the central computer and resetting outdoor tracking relays. I am only equipped for computer repairs.
I will provide you with the tracking relays' coordinates, but be advised: the outdoors are dangerous.
You fix the computer, and I'll reset the tracking relays.
Let's get to work.
There's no better way to find Doctor Godera?
Sounds time-consuming.
Negative. The Imp discovered a flaw in my maker's security. In organic euphemism, he got lucky.
Anything in my way dies. Get to work fixing that central computer.
Not for me.
Jedi were never included in Doctor Godera's "Republic coward" designation. Now I comprehend why.
Commencing computer repairs. Contact me when all tracking relays are reset. Then we can triangulate Doctor Godera's location.
If you encounter any Imp scum, please annihilate them. How you handle Republic cowards is your discretion. Good luck, Jedi.
Blasted Imps. Death is too good for them.
Thank you for liberating this facility. Good riddance to Imp scum.
Are you one of Doctor Godera's droids? What happened here?
What are you?
They were living beings. I took no pleasure in their deaths.
That's an awful thing to say.
The Imps received what they deserved. I will shed no fluids in their memory.
Wish my Teeseven had a personality like you.
You're my kind of droid.
T7 = one-of-a-kind + acquired taste
Teeseven units lack the subroutines to properly appreciate Imp destruction.
The only good Imp is a dead Imp.
Come then, Jedi. I assure you, I will be prepared.
